availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Emory R. Harrington (Boyle County, Kentucky silversmith and soldier)

body.p: Boyle County, Kentucky silversmith and soldier. New York native. Silversmith in Boyle County, Kentucky in 1860. Served in the 4th Kentucky Mounted Infantry (U.S.A.) as Private from October 9, 1861 to March 1, 1862. Served in the 4th Kentucky Mounted Infantry as 2nd Lieutenant from March 1, 1862 to December 14, 1862. Served in the 4th Kentucky Mounted Infantry as Captain from December 14, 1862 to September 29, 1864. Prisoner of war from July 30, 1864 until his death by disease at Atlanta on September 29, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, p. 899.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 634.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 183.
Find A Grave, "Capt. Emory R. Harrington (1835-Sep 29, 1864)," Memorial #33849512, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/33849512 (accessed July 31, 2020).
